Package com.marklogic.flux.api

All Flux functionality can be accessed starting with the Flux class, which provides a static method corresponding to each command available in the Flux CLI. Each method returns a subclass of the Executor interface. The subclass has from and to methods that allow for options to be defined for how data is read by the command and how data is written or processed by the command.

To support a fluent approach where methods on a Executor can be chained together, the from and to methods accept an instance of java.util.function.Consumer that provides access to a command-specific options object. The following example demonstrates this pattern in action: 

     Flux.importGenericFiles()
         .from(options -> options
             .path("/path/to/files")
             .compressionType("zip"))
         .connectionString("user:password@host:8000")
         .to(options -> options
             .collections("my-files")
             .permissions("rest-reader,read,rest-writer,update"))
         .execute();
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AggregateJsonFilesImporter
    Read either JSON Lines files or files containing arrays of JSON objects from supported file locations using Spark's JSON support, and write each object as a JSON document to MarkLogic.
    AggregateJsonFilesImporter.ReadJsonFilesOptions  
    AggregateXmlFilesImporter
    Read aggregate XML files from supported file locations with each row being written to MarkLogic.
    AggregateXmlFilesImporter.ReadXmlFilesOptions  
    ArchiveFilesExporter
    Read documents and their metadata from MarkLogic and write them to ZIP files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3.
    ArchiveFilesExporter.ReadArchiveDocumentOptions  
    ArchiveFilesExporter.WriteArchiveFilesOptions  
    ArchiveFilesImporter
    Read local, HDFS, and S3 Flux archive files and write the documents in each archive to MarkLogic.
    ArchiveFilesImporter.ReadArchiveFilesOptions  
    ArchiveFilesImporter.WriteArchiveDocumentsOptions  
    AvroFilesExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to Avro files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3 using Spark's Avro support.
    AvroFilesImporter
    Read Avro files from supported file locations using Spark's Avro support, and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    AzureStorageOptions  
    ClassifierOptions  
    ConnectionOptions  
    CustomDocumentsExporter
    Read documents from MarkLogic and write them using a custom Spark connector or data source.
    CustomExportWriteOptions  
    CustomImporter
    Read data via a custom Spark connector or data source and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    CustomImporter.CustomReadOptions  
    CustomRowsExporter
    Read rows from MarkLogic and write them using a custom Spark connector or data source.
    DelimitedFilesExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to delimited text files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3 using Spark's CSV support.
    DelimitedFilesExporter.WriteDelimitedFilesOptions  
    DelimitedFilesImporter
    Read delimited text files from supported file locations using Spark's CSV support, and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    DelimitedFilesImporter.ReadDelimitedFilesOptions  
    DocumentCopier
    Copy documents from one database to another database, which can also be the originating database.
    DocumentCopier.CopyReadDocumentsOptions  
    DocumentCopier.CopyWriteDocumentsOptions  
    EmbedderOptions  
    Executor<T extends Executor>
    Top-level interface for objects that can execute some type of batch process involving a connection to MarkLogic.
    Flux
    Entry point for executing Flux commands via the API.
    GenericFilesExporter
    Read documents from MarkLogic and write them to a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3.
    GenericFilesExporter.WriteGenericFilesOptions  
    GenericFilesImporter
    Read local, HDFS, and S3 files and write the contents of each file as a document in MarkLogic.
    GenericFilesImporter.ReadGenericFilesOptions  
    GenericFilesImporter.WriteGenericDocumentsOptions  
    JdbcExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to a table using Spark's JDBC support.
    JdbcExporter.WriteRowsOptions  
    JdbcImporter
    Read rows using Spark's JDBC support and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    JdbcImporter.ReadJdbcOptions  
    JdbcOptions<T extends JdbcOptions>  
    JsonLinesFilesExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to JSON Lines files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3 using Spark's JSON support.
    JsonLinesFilesExporter.WriteJsonLinesFilesOptions  
    MlcpArchiveFilesImporter
    Read local, HDFS, and S3 archive files written by MLCP and write the documents in each archive to MarkLogic.
    MlcpArchiveFilesImporter.ReadMlcpArchiveFilesOptions  
    OrcFilesExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to ORC files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3 using Spark's ORC support.
    OrcFilesImporter
    Read ORC files from supported file locations using Spark's ORC support, and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    ParquetFilesExporter
    Read rows via Optic from MarkLogic and write them to Parquet files on a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3 using Spark's Parquet support.
    ParquetFilesImporter
    Read Parquet files from supported file locations using Spark's Parquet support, and write JSON or XML documents to MarkLogic.
    RdfFilesExporter
    Read triples from MarkLogic and write them to a local filesystem, HDFS, or S3.
    RdfFilesExporter.ReadTriplesDocumentsOptions  
    RdfFilesExporter.WriteRdfFilesOptions  
    RdfFilesImporter
    Read RDF data from supported file locations and write the data as managed triples documents in MarkLogic.
    RdfFilesImporter.ReadRdfFilesOptions  
    RdfFilesImporter.WriteTriplesDocumentsOptions  
    ReadDocumentsOptions<T extends ReadDocumentsOptions>  
    ReadFilesOptions<T extends ReadFilesOptions>  
    ReadRowsOptions  
    ReadTabularFilesOptions
    For objects that can import tabular files, where the data source supports additional options that do not have dedicated methods in the importer interface.
    Reprocessor
    Read data from MarkLogic via custom code and reprocess it via custom code.
    Reprocessor.ReadOptions  
    Reprocessor.WriteOptions  
    SplitterOptions  
    TdeOptions  
    WriteDocumentsOptions<T extends WriteDocumentsOptions>  
    WriteFilesOptions<T extends WriteFilesOptions>  
    WriteSparkFilesOptions
    For objects that can export files via a Spark data source, where the Spark data source supports additional options that do not have dedicated methods in the exporter interface.

    Defines options for writing "structured" documents - i.e.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AuthenticationType  
    AzureStorageType  
    CompressionType  
    DocumentType
    Defines the document types that can be used to force a type when importing files with URI extensions unrecognized by MarkLogic.
    GenericFilesImporter.DocumentType Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
    Use DocumentType instead
    SaveMode
    Defines how data should be written to an external source if data already exists at the given location.
    SplitterOptions.ChunkDocumentType  
    SslHostnameVerifier  
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    FluxException
    Wraps any exception not thrown by the MarkLogic Spark connector so that API users are not exposed directly to Spark exceptions.
